Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Drug or Chemical by Structure/Inorganic Chemical/Element/Isotope/Radioisotope/Strontium-89,/NCIThesaurus/Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Analgesic Agent/Adjuvant Analgesic/Strontium-89
Record.BroaderTerm: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Description: A radioisotope of strontium, a heavy metal found naturally as a non-radioactive element. With a half-life of 50 days, strontium-89 is a beta emitter that is metabolized much like calcium. This agent is preferentially absorbed by osteoblastic bone metastases. (NCI04)
